title: type critique
content:
Hi everyone,

I'm in the beginning stages of this new type I'm working on called Lundan. I'm new to typography but I think I've got the basics down and I was wondering if anyone had any critique of my uppercase for me? I don't have a Z yet, obviously but it is a WIP. Any help is much appreciated. PLEASE BE HARSH.

Updated since comments below.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lundanbeta.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725164341/http:/typophile.com/files/lundanbeta.png) | 20.3 KB |
| [lundanwash.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725164341/http:/typophile.com/files/lundanwash.png) | 23.4 KB |
author: lundeja

comments.content:
I like it. Some how got a asian feel over it. Miss a little variation in some of firgures thou. E F P B K H. But super work!

Casper

Thanks casperobro, funny you should mention those characters because I have alternate versions for all of them, ha.

Jared Lunde  
 [http://www.jaredlunde.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725164341/http:/www.jaredlunde.com/ "http://www.jaredlunde.com/")

U and W look a bit out of place to me but it would be difficult to give them the same bottom right turn that most others have. Having said that C and G seem to fit the rhythm. I think what it is is that most of the letters have a slightly hand painted look which I like. They could have all been painted with single strokes of a wide brush. However the U and W look sharper with more geometric precision.

You're right, Justin. Maybe adding the tail from the Q to the U and W, too would work?

Jared Lunde  
 [http://www.jaredlunde.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725164341/http:/www.jaredlunde.com/ "http://www.jaredlunde.com/")
